Selected Answer: C
C. business and IT management responsible for building and deploying I&T solutions.

The primary target audience for COBIT (Control Objectives for Information and Related Technologies) is typically business and IT management responsible for building and deploying I&T (Information and Technology) solutions within an organization. COBIT provides guidance and best practices for effective governance and management of enterprise IT, including areas such as risk management, performance measurement, and control frameworks. It is designed to help business and IT management understand and address IT-related risks and align IT investments with business objectives. While COBIT may also be used by assurance professionals for evaluating internal controls and by anyone responsible for the governance solution, its primary focus is on providing guidance to business and IT management in managing and governing IT effectively.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an enterprise goal that would MOST likely be evaluated by using a metric "percent of services that meet or exceed targets in revenues and market share"?
Which of the following is a PRIMARY benefit associated with the management objective "managed strategy"?

choices.C: Service delivery is facilitated by adopting the latest technology innovations.
choices.B: Effective communication channels are established across all levels of management.
choices.A: Desired value is delivered through a roadmap of incremental changes.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Desired value is delivered through a roadmap of incremental changes. By strategically planning and implementing changes incrementally, organizations can achieve their desired outcomes while minimizing risks and disruptions. This approach ensures that the strategy aligns with business goals and evolves over time
